data.title: Personal Pronouns Exercises
data.meta_description: Personal Pronouns Exercises: Find out if you know the personal pronouns in English and how they are used in sentences by working out the personal pronouns exercises given in this article.
data.text:
Personal pronouns include first-person, second-person and third-person pronouns. They are used to identify the speaker/listener or the person/thing being referred to. I, me, you, we, us, he, him, she, her, it, they and them are the different personal pronouns in the English language. To help you practise the use of these pronouns, this article provides you with some exercises.

Personal Pronouns Exercises with Answers

Here are a few exercises on personal pronouns. Go through them and complete them. You can check your answers once you are done with them.

Exercise 1 – Fill in the blanks

Read the following sentences and fill in the blanks with suitable personal pronouns.

Do you know ____? ___ is my brother.

Emilia is a great dancer. ___ has won many competitions.

Would ___ like to go to the movies with Rita?

Van Gogh drew beautiful pictures. One of ___ famous works is The Starry Night.

When the incident happened, Ram was present there. ____ was the sole witness of the event.

The dog gave birth to many puppies. Would ____ like to have one of ____?

Ross and Monica are siblings. ___ came to visit the museum.

This is Elizabeth. ___ is the class monitor.

The team won the match. ___ played surprisingly well.

My brother brought a new phone, but ___ doesn’t like ___ much.

Look at this picture. Isn’t ___ beautiful?

__ all study in the same school.

I brought a ball today. ___ is mine.

Megha finished her homework quickly so that ___ could go outside and play.

Can you give ___ another chance? I will do better.

Answers for Exercise 1

Do you know him? He is my brother.

Emilia is a great dancer. She has won many competitions.

Would you like to go to the movies with Rita?

Van Gogh drew beautiful pictures. One of his famous works is ‘The Starry Night’.

When the incident happened, Ram was present there. He was the sole witness of the event.

The dog gave birth to many puppies. Would you like to have one of them?

Ross and Monica are siblings. They came to visit the museum.

This is Elizabeth. She is the class monitor.

The team won the match. They played surprisingly well.

My brother brought a new phone, but he doesn’t like it much.

Look at this picture. Isn’t it beautiful?

We all study in the same school.

I brought a ball today. It is mine.

Megha finished her homework quickly so that she could go outside and play.

Can you give me another chance? I will do better.

Exercise 2 – Identify the personal pronouns

Read the given sentences and identify the personal pronouns used.

I have a sister. We love each other very much.

They have come to see the movie.

Are you familiar with Newton’s Law of Motion?

He and I have grown up together.

I have known him for a very long time.

The woman was crossing the street when the truck hit her.

Did you see the new car? It belongs to them.

My brother brought a pizza. We all will enjoy it.

Do you know this lady? She is my aunt.

The family sells pancakes. They have been in this profession for ages.

This is Froddo, my dog. It is a Husky.

Would you like to share the seat with me?

The teacher asked her to speak first.

You can accompany us.

Have they reached?

Answers for Exercise 2

I, We

They

You

He, I

I, Him

Her

You, Them

We

You, She

They

It

You, Me

Her

You, Us

They

Frequently Asked Questions on Personal Pronouns Exercises

Q1

What are personal pronouns?

Personal pronouns are used to refer to the person/thing that the speaker is referring to. For example, Tina invited her home.

Q2

What are the different personal pronouns?

Pronouns like he, she, it., they, us, you, me, him, her, them, I and we are known as personal pronouns.
